alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:33PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fairfield, north central Richland and southwestern Kershaw Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 833 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairfield County Airport, or 7 miles southwest of Springdale, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Forest Acres, Dentsville, Arcadia Lakes, Woodfield, Sesquicentennial State Park, Lake Carolina, Villages at Sandhill, Elgin, Killian, Lugoff, Blythewood, Ridgeway, Upper Richland Fire Station, Smallwood and Cedar Creek Fire Station. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 70 and 81. Interstate 77 between mile markers 11 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
